brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to use the BIS monitor to assess the degree of consciousness in
      pre-terminal palliative patients admitted to our palliative care unit and to ascertain if
      this tool provides a more accurate assessment of consciousness in this specific group of
      patients than clinical observation of consciousness and the use of sedation scales.

      We hypothesize that the measured BIS results provide a more accurate assessment of the
      patient's level of consciousness than routine clinical observation or the use of sedation
      scales.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring Depth of Unconsciousness at the End of Life Using Bispectral Index (BIS)
clinical_study.condition: Loss of Consciousness at End of Life.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pre-terminal palliative patients with a life expectancy of 72 hours or less at the
             start of the observation.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  lack of consent of patient or representative

clinical_study.official_title: Measuring Depth of Unconsciousness at the End of Life: the Reliability of the BIS Monitoring as an Assessment Tool Versus Sedation Scales

other_outcome.description: Determining the evolution of sedation scores, measured with the Observer's Assessment of Alertness/Sedation scale and the Richmond Agitation and Sedation Scale in pre-terminal patients admitted to a palliative care unit with a life expectancy of 72 hours or less.
other_outcome.measure: Determining the evolution of sedation scores, measured with the Observer's Assessment of Alertness/Sedation scale and the Richmond Agitation and Sedation Scale in pre-terminal patients
Determining if and in what degree the measured BIS values correspond to the measured sedation scores.

other_outcome.description: Determining if there is a noticeable difference between the BIS scores and sedation scale scores of patients with medically induced sedation and those of patients losing consciousness as part of a normal dying process.
other_outcome.measure: Determining if there is a noticeable difference between the BIS scores and sedation scale scores of patients with medically induced sedation

primary_outcome.description: Measuring the accuracy of BIS monitoring in assessing the evolution of  the level of consciousness in pre-terminal patients with a life expectancy of 72 hours or less from the moment of the first clinical signs of dying and loss of consciousness until the moment of death.
primary_outcome.measure: Measuring the accuracy of BIS monitoring in assessing the evolution of  the level of consciousness in pre-terminal patients
